UMP DKI Naik Jadi Rp4,2 Juta, Anies Baswedan Ikut Aturan Pusat
01 Nov 2019, 10:43 by Imam Hamdi, Zacharias Wuragil
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Gubernur DKI Jakarta Anies Baswedan mengumumkan upah minimum provinsi atau UMP DKI 2020 sebesar Rp 4.276.349, atau naik 8,51 persen sesuai besaran yang diatur pemerintah pusat. Dia memutuskan itu sekalipun sejumlah massa buruh berusaha 'melobi' menuntut kenaikan UMP yang lebih besar, menjadi Rp4,6 juta, dua hari sebelumnya.
"Penetapan UMP DKI ini sesuai dengan dasar hukum yang berlaku baik undang-undang maupun aturan pemerintah (Kementerian Ketenagakerjaan)," kata Anies di Balai Kota DKI, Jumat 1 November 2019.
Anies menuturkan pengumuman upah ini dilakukan serentak di setiap provinsi hari ini. Terkait kenaikan upah di DKI, kata dia, bakal diimbangi dengan insentif khusus dari Pemerintah DKI kepada buruh yang gajinya setara UMP hingga lebih 10 persen di atasnya.
Insentif berupa subsidi yang disalurkan melalui Kartu Pekerja DKI. Mereka yang menggenggam kartu itu dijanjikannya gratis menggunakan Jak Lingko, anaknya mendapat Kartu Jakarta Pintar atau KJP Plus dan memperoleh jalur afirmasi saat mendaftar sekolah. "Program Kartu Pekerja ini telah kami luncurkan sejak 2018," ujarnya.
Anies menambahkan, pemerintah juga bekerja sama dengan serikat dan federasi buruh mendistribusikan kebutuhan pokok lewat koperasi yang dibangun PD Pasar Jaya. "Jadi kami membantu mengurangi belanja kebutuhan mereka dengan subsidi."
Anies Baswedan tak menjelaskan jumlah buruh pemilik Kartu Pekerja saat ini dan anggaran subsidi yang akan dialokasikannya 2020. "Nanti akan kami sampaikan datanya sekaligus grafiknya," katanya.
Kepala Dinas Tenaga Kerja DKI Jakarta Andri Yansah mengatakan UMP DKI mengacu pada Peraturan Pemerintah nomor 78 tahun 2015 tentang Pengupahan. Pemerintah pusat, kata dia, telah mengeluarkan Surat Edaran Kementerian Tenaga Kerja nomor 308 tahun 2019 yang memerintahkan upah minimum di ibu kota naik hingga 8,51 persen. "Kami juga telah melakukan survey sebelum menetapkan UMP DKI," ujarnya.
text:
DKI UMP Increases to Rp4.2 Million, Anies Baswedan Joins Central Rules
01 Nov 2019, 10:43 by Imam Hamdi, Zacharias Wuragil
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - DKI Jakarta Governor Anies Baswedan announced the provincial minimum wage or DKI Jakarta 2020 UMP of Rp 4,276,349, or an increase of 8.51 percent according to the amount set by the central government. He decided that even though a number of workers tried to 'lobby' for a larger UMP increase, to Rp4.6 million, two days earlier.
"The determination of the DKI UMP is in accordance with the applicable legal basis both laws and government regulations (the Ministry of Manpower)," Anies said at the City Hall, Friday 1 November 2019.
Anies said the wage announcement was carried out simultaneously in each province today. Related to wage increases in DKI, he said, would be offset by special incentives from the DKI Government to workers whose salaries are equivalent to UMP up to more than 10 percent above.
Incentives in the form of subsidies are channeled through the DKI Worker Card. Those who hold the card are promised free using Jak Lingko, their children get the Jakarta Smart Card or KJP Plus and get an affirmation path when registering for school. "We have launched the Workers Card Program since 2018," he said.
Anies added, the government also cooperates with unions and labor federations distributing basic needs through cooperatives built by PD Pasar Jaya. "So we help reduce their spending needs with subsidies."
Anies Baswedan did not explain the current number of Workers' Card holders and the subsidy budget they will allocate in 2020. "We will share the data and graphs later," he said.
The Head of DKI Jakarta Manpower Office Andri Yansah said that the Jakarta UMP refers to Government Regulation number 78 of 2015 concerning Wages. The central government, he said, had issued a Circular of the Ministry of Manpower number 308 in 2019 which ordered the minimum wage in the capital to rise by 8.51 percent. "We have also conducted a survey before establishing the DKI UMP," he said.
